user_input: Consider the Exclusive License and Product Development Agreement between Eton Pharmaceuticals, Inc. and Aucta Pharmaceuticals, Inc.; Are there any services to be provided after the termination of this contract?
response:
Based on the provided information, if the Agreement is terminated by Eton Pharmaceuticals, Inc. (ECTON), clauses 11.5.1 and 11.5.2 of the agreement outline the consequences. According to clause 11.5.1, upon termination by Eton, Aucta Pharmaceuticals, Inc. (AUCTA) may keep all payments under Section 6 paid by Eton up to the point of termination. Additionally, all rights granted to Eton shall revert to AUCTA. Eton shall request consent from the contract manufacturing organization (if necessary) that the commercial supply agreement with the contract manufacturing organization be assigned to AUCTA.

However, if the Agreement is terminated by AUCTA, as per clause 11.5.2, AUCTA may keep all payments under Section 6 paid by Eton up to the point of termination. In this case, Eton shall request consent from the contract manufacturing organization (if necessary) that the commercial supply agreement with the contract manufacturing organization be assigned to AUCTA. 

It is important to note that the provided information does not specify any services that would be provided after termination of the agreement, regardless of who initiates the termination.
